trans-unit.source: You can also do this in AngularJS, using component directives. These are directives that define their own templates, controllers, and input/output bindings - the same things that Angular components define. Applications built with component directives are much easier to migrate to Angular than applications built with lower-level features like ng-controller, ng-include, and scope inheritance.
trans-unit.target: También puede hacer esto en AngularJS, utilizando directivas de componentes . Estas son directivas que definen sus propias plantillas, controladores y enlaces de entrada / salida, lo mismo que definen los componentes angulares. Las aplicaciones creadas con directivas de componentes son mucho más fáciles de migrar a Angular que las aplicaciones creadas con funciones de nivel inferior como ng-controller , ng-include y la herencia de alcance.

You can also pass in more than one configuration name as a comma-separated list. For example, to apply both stage and fr build configurations, use the command ng build --configuration stage,fr. In this case, the command parses the named configurations from left to right. If multiple configurations change the same setting, the last-set value is the final one.

You can also preserve query parameters and fragments across navigations without having to provide them again when navigating. trans-unit.target: También puede conservar los parámetros de consulta y los fragmentos en las navegaciones sin tener que proporcionarlos nuevamente al navegar. En LoginComponent , agregará un objeto como segundo argumento en la función router.navigateUrl() y proporcionará queryParamsHandling y preserveFragment para pasar los parámetros de consulta actuales y fragmentarlos a la siguiente ruta.

trans-unit.source: You can build almost any form with an Angular template—login forms, contact forms, and pretty much any business form. Puede diseñar los controles de manera creativa, vincularlos a los datos, especificar reglas de validación y mostrar errores de validación, habilitar o deshabilitar condicionalmente controles específicos, activar la retroalimentación visual incorporada y mucho más.

trans-unit.source: You can build almost any kind of form with an Angular template—login forms, contact forms, and pretty much any business form. You can lay out the controls creatively and bind them to the data in your object model. You can specify validation rules and display validation errors, conditionally enable or disable specific controls, trigger built-in visual feedback, and much more.
You can build forms by writing templates in the Angular template syntax with the form-specific directives and techniques described in this page.

trans-unit.source: You can chain pipes so that the output of one pipe becomes the input to the next.

You can chain pipes together in potentially useful combinations. In the following example, to display the birthday in uppercase, the birthday is chained to the DatePipe and on to the UpperCasePipe. The birthday displays as APR 15, 1988.

trans-unit.source: You can chain pipes, sending the output of one pipe function to be transformed by another pipe function. A pipe can also take arguments that control how it performs its transformation. For example, you can pass the desired format to the date pipe.

trans-unit.source: You can create and include the following kinds of schematics.

You can create and publish new libraries to extend Angular functionality. If you find that you need to solve the same problem in more than one app (or want to share your solution with other developers), you have a candidate for a library.

trans-unit.source: You can create your own schematics to operate on Angular projects. Library developers typically package schematics with their libraries in order to integrate them with the Angular CLI. You can also create stand-alone schematics to manipulate the files and constructs in Angular applications as a way of customizing them for your development environment and making them conform to your standards and constraints. Schematics can be chained, running other schematics to perform complex operations.
trans-unit.target: Puedes crear tus propios esquemas para operar en proyectos angulares.Los desarrolladores de bibliotecas normalmente empaquetan los esquemas con sus bibliotecas para integrarlos con la CLI Angular.También puede crear esquemas independientes para manipular los archivos y construcciones en aplicaciones Angular como una forma de personalizarlos para su entorno de desarrollo y hacer que se ajusten a sus estándares y restricciones.Los esquemas pueden ser encadenados,ejecutando otros esquemas para realizar operaciones complejas.

trans-unit.source: You can have multiple guards at every level of a routing hierarchy. The router checks the CanDeactivate and CanActivateChild guards first, from the deepest child route to the top. Then it checks the CanActivate guards from the top down to the deepest child route. If the feature module is loaded asynchronously, the CanLoad guard is checked before the module is loaded. If any guard returns false, pending guards that have not completed will be canceled, and the entire navigation is canceled.
trans-unit.target: Puede tener múltiples guardias en cada nivel de una jerarquía de enrutamiento. El enrutador comprueba primero los guardias CanDeactivate y CanActivateChild , desde la ruta secundaria más profunda hasta la parte superior. Luego verifica los guardias CanActivate desde la parte superior hasta la ruta secundaria más profunda. Si el módulo de características se carga de forma asíncrona, la protección CanLoad se verifica antes de cargar el módulo. Si algún guardia devuelve falso, los guardias pendientes que no se hayan completado se cancelarán y se cancelará toda la navegación.

trans-unit.source: You can make this more efficient with trackBy. Add a method to the component that returns the value NgFor should track. In this case, that value is the hero's id. If the id has already been rendered, Angular keeps track of it and doesn't re-query the server for the same id.
trans-unit.target: Puedes hacer esto más eficiente con trackBy . Agregue un método al componente que devuelve el valor que NgFor debe rastrear. trans-unit.source: You can take steps to mitigate both bundle size and performance issues. By isolating your AngularJS app to a separate bundle, you can take advantage of lazy loading to load, bootstrap, and render the AngularJS application only when needed. This strategy reduces your initial bundle size, defers any potential impact from loading both frameworks until absolutely necessary, and keeps your application running as efficiently as possible.
trans-unit.target: Puede tomar medidas para mitigar tanto el tamaño del paquete como los problemas de rendimiento. Al aislar su aplicación AngularJS en un paquete separado, puede aprovechar la carga diferida para cargar, arrancar y renderizar la aplicación AngularJS solo cuando sea necesario. Esta estrategia reduce el tamaño inicial de su paquete, difiere cualquier impacto potencial de cargar ambos marcos hasta que sea absolutamente necesario y mantiene su aplicación ejecutándose de la manera más eficiente posible.

trans-unit.source: You could lazy load the Crisis Center. trans-unit.source: You could lazy load the Crisis Center. By the time the user navigates to the Crisis Center, its module will have been loaded and ready.

But doing so could require a lot of setup, especially when its template features an *ngFor repeater, other components, layout HTML, additional bindings, a constructor that injects multiple services, and it starts interacting with those services right away.

trans-unit.source: You might have noticed that the CLI adds RouterModule.forRoot(routes) to the AppRoutingModuleimports array. This lets Angular know that the AppRoutingModule is a routing module and forRoot() specifies that this is the root routing module. It configures all the routes you pass to it, gives you access to the router directives, and registers the Router service. Use forRoot() only once in the application, inside the AppRoutingModule.

You might have noticed that the CLI adds RouterModule.forRoot(routes) to the app-routing.module.tsimports array. This lets Angular know that this module, AppRoutingModule, is a routing module and forRoot() specifies that this is the root routing module. It configures all the routes you pass to it, gives you access to the router directives, and registers the RouterService. Use forRoot() in the AppRoutingModule—that is, one time in the app at the root level.
trans-unit.target: Es posible que haya notado que la CLI agrega RouterModule.forRoot(routes) a la matriz de imports app-routing.module.ts . Esto le permite a Angular saber que este módulo, AppRoutingModule , es un módulo de enrutamiento y forRoot() especifica que este es el módulo de enrutamiento raíz. Configura todas las rutas que le pasa, le da acceso a las directivas del enrutador y registra el RouterService . Use forRoot() en AppRoutingModule , es decir, una vez en la aplicación en el nivel raíz.

trans-unit.source: You must configure an injector with a provider, or it won't know how to create the dependency. The most obvious way for an injector to create an instance of a service class is with the class itself. If you specify the service class itself as the provider token, the default behavior is for the injector to instantiate that class with new.
trans-unit.target: Debe configurar un inyector con un proveedor, o no sabrá cómo crear la dependencia. La forma más obvia para que un inyector cree una instancia de una clase de servicio es con la clase misma. Si especifica la clase de servicio en sí como el token del proveedor, el comportamiento predeterminado es que el inyector cree una instancia de esa clase con new .

trans-unit.source: You'll notice two different types of redirects. The first change is from /heroes to /superheroes without any parameters. This is a straightforward redirect, unlike the change from /hero/:id to /superhero/:id, which includes the :id route parameter. Router redirects also use powerful pattern matching, so the Router inspects the URL and replaces route parameters in the path with their appropriate destination. Previously, you navigated to a URL such as /hero/15 with a route parameter id of 15.
trans-unit.target: Notarás dos tipos diferentes de redireccionamientos. El primer cambio es de /heroes a /superheroes sin ningún parámetro. Esta es una redirección directa, a diferencia del cambio de /hero/:id a /superhero/:id , que incluye el parámetro :id route. Los redireccionamientos de enrutadores también utilizan una potente coincidencia de patrones, por lo que el Router inspecciona la URL y reemplaza los parámetros de ruta en la path con su destino apropiado. Anteriormente, navegaba a una URL como /hero/15 con un id de parámetro de ruta de 15 .

trans-unit.source: You've setup the routes for navigating around your application and used navigation imperatively and declaratively. But like any application, requirements change over time. You've setup links and navigation to /heroes and /hero/:id from the HeroListComponent and HeroDetailComponent components. If there were a requirement that links to heroes become superheroes, you would still want the previous URLs to navigate correctly. You also don't want to update every link in your application, so redirects makes refactoring routes trivial.

You've setup the routes for navigating around your application. You've used navigation imperatively and declaratively to many different routes. But like any application, requirements change over time. You've setup links and navigation to /heroes and /hero/:id from the HeroListComponent and HeroDetailComponent components. If there was a requirement that links to heroes become superheroes, you still want the previous URLs to navigate correctly. You also don't want to go and update every link in your application, so redirects makes refactoring routes trivial.
trans-unit.target: Ha configurado las rutas para navegar por su aplicación. Has utilizado la navegación de manera imperativa y declarativa en muchas rutas diferentes. Pero como cualquier aplicación, los requisitos cambian con el tiempo. Ha configurado enlaces y navegación a /heroes y /hero/:id desde los componentes HeroListComponent y HeroDetailComponent . Si existía el requisito de que los enlaces a heroes convirtieran en superheroes , aún desea que las URL anteriores naveguen correctamente. Tampoco desea ir y actualizar todos los enlaces de su aplicación, por lo que las redirecciones hacen que la refactorización de las rutas sea trivial.

trans-unit.source: You've wrapped the whole template in an ngIf that causes it only to be rendered when there is a phone present. A diferencia de AngularJS, las expresiones angulares no fallan en silencio cuando intenta hacer referencia a propiedades en objetos indefinidos. Debe ser explícito sobre los casos en que esto se espera.
